info.name: Secure Access by Duo Impact Lab

query.description:
The maximum number of records returned in a paged set of results.

Each endpoint that supports paged results has its own limit settings, specified like "Default: 100; Max: 300".

If a request specifies a value greater than the endpoint's maximum limit, max value is used.

The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.

When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.

The maximum number of records returned in a paged set of results.

Each endpoint that supports paged results has its own limit settings, specified like "Default: 100; Max: 300".

If a request specifies a value greater than the endpoint's maximum limit, max value is used.

The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.

When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.
The maximum number of records returned.

The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.

When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.

Default: 0

exec: var DATE = currentDate.utc().format("ddd, DD MMM YYYY HH:mm:ss ZZ");
//HOST is retrieved from the environment variable itself, since parsing the hostname using
//postman-collection's URL object will just give you the variable name.

query.description: The maximum number of records returned.

The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.

When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.

Default: 0

exec: var DATE = currentDate.utc().format("ddd, DD MMM YYYY HH:mm:ss ZZ");
//HOST is retrieved from the environment variable itself, since parsing the hostname using
//postman-collection's URL object will just give you the variable name.

query.description: The IP address of the user to be authenticated, in dotted quad format. This will cause an "allow" response to be sent if appropriate for requests from a trusted network.

Permanent, unique identifier for the user as generated by Duo upon user creation (e.g. DUYHV6TJBC3O4RITS1WC).

Exactly one of user_id and username must be specified.

Unique identifier for the user that is commonly specified by your application during user creation (e.g. user@domain.com).

Exactly one of user_id and username must be specified.

If the trusted_device_token is present and the Remembered Devices option is enabled in the Duo Admin Panel, return an "allow" response for the period of time a device may be remembered as set by the Duo administrator.

request.description: This is an example of a manual, synchronous push to a user ("example.user") with custom headers, context and fields. This functionality has potential to be used in a lot of different cases when it comes to verifying behaviour: not just log-ins!

exec: let DATE = (moment().format("ddd, DD MMM YYYY HH:mm:ss ZZ"));
//HOST is retrieved from the environment variable itself, since parsing the hostname using
//postman-collection's URL object will just give you the variable name.

query.description: The maximum number of records returned.

The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.

When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.

Default: 0

Retrieve specific groups by specifying up to 200 group_ids values.

List format: group_ids=DGAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA&group_ids=DGBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB&...etc.

Ignores other paging parameters when used.

urlencoded.description: Required - The name of the group.
Optional - The authentication status of the group. See Retrieve Groups for a list of possible values.
Required - The name of the group.
Optional - The authentication status of the group. See Retrieve Groups for a list of possible values.

query.description: The maximum number of records returned.

The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.

When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.
